 mostly pretty chunky like the Owari guards.

Rich

 Re: [nihontostudy] Akasaka Age


  Richard,
  For some reason I can't use =
your links - I get an error message saying the file is inaccessible.  (Same=
 thing that happened before.)  

  Is this the tsuba labeled Akasaka-1 & 2 =
in your folder ("Sashimono in negative silhouette and clouds in positive si=
lhouette")?  

  4 mm would be unusually thin for early Akasaka.  The late =
guards can be that thin.
  Jim 



    Hi all, I picked this Akasaka tsuba =
up some time ago. It was sold to me as Sh=F4ami I think from memory. I  per=
sonally believed it to be from around the 6th or 7th Gen Akasaka line, thou=
gh unsure who in that line may have made it.

    A few months back I took =
it to a trip to Melbourne and showed it to some friends and our local Kod=
=F4gu expert there believed it was early Akasaka, maybe around the time of =
the 2 - 4th gen.

    It is Wak sized and about 4mm thick. Any thought's ?

heers all

    Rich
